snippet: Once a mostly Democratic cause, government-funded preschool has been embraced by both parties outside Washington, with Republican governors pushing some of the biggest increases in preschool spending.
abstract: Enrollment in state-funded preschool has more than doubled since 2002, to about 30 percent of all 4-year-olds nationwide, with research pointing to importance of early child development; government-funded preschool has become bipartisan cause outside Washington, with Republican governors pushing some of the biggest increases in preschool spending.

byline.original: By RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and MOTOKO RICH

lead_paragraph: Once a mostly Democratic cause, government-funded preschool has been embraced by both parties outside Washington, with Republican governors pushing some of the biggest increases in preschool spending.

headline.main: Preschool Push Moving Ahead in Many States
headline.print_headline: Preschool Push Moving Ahead in Many States
